DAvID A. WALLACE, Director
GEORGE E. KOSTRITSKY, Project Director {
HARRY B. COOPER, Project Director
*WILLIAM H. PorTs, JR., Principal Planner
JEREMIAH D. O’LEARY, Senior Planner
WiLLIAM C. MCDONNELL, Planner 11
*JAMES H. MILLER, Planning Technician
*RUVELLE S. FALCONE, Research Analyst
VicTorIiA A. KLisSHIS, T'ypist
*Project Team

CREDITS

Historic Prints—Peale Museum

Aerial Photography—Maps, Incorporated

Base Maps—Department of Planning and U.S.G.S.
Baltimore Regional Planning Counecil
Encouragement—H, Warren Buckler, Jr.



26 April, 1961

Dr. Frank C. Marino, President
Board of Recreation and Parks

Mr. Douglas H. Gordon, President
Municipal Art Society of Baltlmore
Baltimore, Maryland

Dear Sirs:

In accordance with our contract dated 26
October, 1960, The Planning Council has
completed its study of the Jones Falls Valley.





The accompanying report substantiates the
Council’s strong feeling that herein lies a
critical and timely opportunity for the Balti-
more Region. Positive action toward realiza-
tion of this plan will place Baltimore in the
forefront of a national awakening to the
aesthetic and practical value of parks and
open spaces.

The Planning Council believes that this Plan
is feasible. It will, in the long run, benefit
the City and Region increasingly with the
years, creating an environment we will all be
proud to pass on to our descendents.

Respectfully submittéd,

J ofm E. Motz, Chairman
